verses.verse: So that then thou shalt saye: O Lorde, I wyll thanke the, for thou waste displeased at me, but refrayne thou from thy wrath, and comforte me.
Behold, God is my saluacion in whom I will trust, and not be afrayde. For the Lorde God is my strength, & my songe, he also is become my saluacion.
Therfore with ioye shall ye drawe water out of the welles of the Sauioure,
& then shall ye saye: geue thanckes vnto the lorde, call vpon his name, declare his councels amonge the people, kepe them in remembrance, for his name is excellent.
O syng prayses vnto the Lord, for he hath done greate thynges, as it is knowne in all the worlde.
Crye out, and syng thou that dwellest in Syon, for great is the holy one of Israell in the myddes of the.
